markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

nj.com  (WEB - en-US)

A news website featuring coverage of New Jersey including politics, business, sports, and entertainment.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

NJ.com is owned by Advance Publications, a privately held American media and technology company owned by the Newhouse family. Advance Publications also owns NJ Advance Media, a marketing agency that curates content for print and digital publications based in New Jersey. Advance Publications is a part of Advance Local Media, a collection of 10 local media groups based in New Jersey, New York, Chicago, Philadelphia, and other cities.

The site runs advertisements and sponsored content.

Content

Articles cover both national and local news, politics, sports, and entertainment. NJ.com publishes and curates articles from New Jersey-based publications owned by Advance, including the Star-Ledger, The Times of Trenton, and the Jersey Journal. The site publishes national and international news from The Associated Press.

Credibility

Articles on the site are generally balanced and well-sourced, and headlines are measured and accurate. Opinion is separated from news content.

Articles indicate when they have been corrected or updated, although the site does not state a corrections policy.

Transparency

Articles are bylined with their author’s contact information, and some link to biographical blurbs. Contact details for the publication’s directors, producers, and vice president of content are featured on NJ Advance Media’s website, which is linked through nj.com’s About Us page.

NJ.com’s Contact Us page provides a form for comments and questions, including coverage requests and tips.

Sponsored content is clearly marked.

History

NJ.com was registered as a domain in October 1994. NJ Advance Media was launched in 2014.

Kat Harling
